xml.brief: Retrieve information on a single log entry

desc.p: Retrieve information on a single log entry.

opt.name: fields
opt.p: Pipe-separated list of field names which you are interested with. Selected fields will be included in the response.

ul.li: uuid - unique ID of the log entry,
cache_code - code of the cache which the log entry refers to,

li.p: date - date and time (ISO 8601) when the log entry was submitted.
Note, that some OpenCaching servers don't store the exact times along with the log entries.

ul.li: uuid - ID of the user (author of the log entry),
username - name of the user (who submitted the log entry),
profile_url - URL of the profile page of the user,

li.p: type - string; log type. This could be pretty much everything, but there are five primary types:

ul.li: "Found it" and "Didn't find it" - for all Non-Event Caches,

li.p: You may treat every other string as "Comment".
was_recommended - true, if the author included his recommendation in this log entry,

ul.li: comment - HTML string, text entered with the log entry,

li.p: internal_id - undocumented, you should not use this unless you really know you need to. Internal IDs are not unique across various OKAPI installations. Try to use UUIDs instead.

opt.p: Note, that some fields can change in time (users can edit/delete their log entries).

returns.p: A dictionary of fields you have selected.
If given log entry does not exist, the method will respond with an HTTP 400 error.
